original_title: Star bowler lauds full team performance in strong U19WC win

enhanced_data.enhanced_title: Wahid Zadran Hails Team Unity After Afghanistan's Dominant U19 World Cup Victory
enhanced_data.seo_meta_description: Afghanistan crush West Indies by 138 runs at U19 World Cup. Star bowler Wahid Zadran credits team effort as they top Group D. Full match analysis inside.
enhanced_data.full_blog_post_markdown:
## Afghanistan Stamp Their Authority at U19 World Cup with Commanding Win

In a display of complete cricketing excellence, Afghanistan dismantled the West Indies by a massive 138 runs in Windhoek, sending a powerful message to their rivals at the ICC Under-19 Men's Cricket World Cup. But for star bowler Wahid Zadran, personal accolades mean nothing without the collective triumph.

## A Complete Team Performance

Afghanistan's victory was built on contributions across all three disciplines—batting, bowling, and fielding—showcasing the depth and maturity of this young squad.

### Batting Brilliance Sets the Foundation

The Afghan innings was anchored by two standout performances:

- **Osman Sadat** compiled a patient 88 off 131 balls, providing the stability every successful chase-proof total requires
- **Captain Mahboob Khan** exploded with an aggressive 86 off just 69 deliveries, accelerating the scoring rate when it mattered most

Their combined efforts propelled Afghanistan to a commanding 262/6 from their 50 overs—a total that would prove far beyond the Caribbean side's reach.

## Zadran Leads the Bowling Charge

When it was time to defend their total, Wahid Zadran spearheaded the attack with devastating effect. His figures of 3/36 from nine overs set the tone during the crucial Powerplay overs.

> "It's always been a pleasure bowling good at the top of the Powerplay. But the team... I always give the credit to the team, the rest I don't care about. So it's very, very good to get the win."

Zadran's selfless attitude reflects a squad mentality that prioritises collective success over individual glory.

## Fielding Excellence Completes the Package

Often the unsung heroes of cricket, Afghanistan's fielders earned special praise from their leading bowler.

> "I give all the credit to our fielders. We took some brilliant catches and made some brilliant stops, which gives the bowlers lots of confidence and lots of energy."

This synergy between bowlers and fielders created relentless pressure that the West Indies batting lineup simply couldn't withstand.

## Captain Mahboob Leads From the Front

Zadran was quick to highlight his captain's influence on the result:

> "Mahboob is very responsible for the team. He's also the keeper and he was leading from the front today. He did really well, so that was the reason we did really well and we won."

The wicketkeeper-batter's dual role demands exceptional fitness and concentration—qualities Mahboob demonstrated in abundance throughout the contest.

## Eyes on Bigger Prizes

With this comprehensive victory, Afghanistan now sit proudly atop **Group D**, their World Cup aspirations very much alive. For Zadran, however, the focus remains firmly on what lies ahead.

> "It was a day that made history, looking forward, because in cricket, every day's a new day. We just want to take the momentum of today to the next game."

## What's Next for Afghanistan?

The young Afghan side will look to maintain their unbeaten record when they face **Tanzania on Wednesday** in Namibia. A win would further strengthen their position heading into the Super Six stage, where the tournament's true contenders will emerge.

For now, Afghanistan can savour a complete team performance—one that suggests this talented group is capable of going deep into the tournament and perhaps even challenging for the ultimate prize.
